title: High Maternal Mortality Rate
description: In 2015, Chad recorded a maternal mortality ratio of 1389 per 100,000 live births, one of the highest in the world.

title: Prevalence of Child Labor
description: As of 2015, 55.9% of children aged 7-14 in Chad were engaged in employment, indicating a significant child labor issue.

title: High Multidimensional Poverty
description: In 2019, 84.2% of Chad's population lived in multidimensional poverty, highlighting widespread deprivation.

title: High Teenage Pregnancy Rate
description: In 2015, 35.9% of women aged 15-19 in Chad had children or were pregnant, reflecting high teenage pregnancy rates.

title: Significant Belief in Domestic Violence Justification
description: In 2015, 48.6% of women in Chad believed a husband is justified in beating his wife for burning food, indicating deep-rooted gender inequality.

title: High Wanted Fertility Rate
description: Chad had a wanted fertility rate of 6.1 births per woman in 2015, one of the highest globally, indicating a preference for larger families.

title: Rapid Rural Population Growth
description: In 2023, Chad experienced a rural population growth rate of 4.17%, suggesting a significant increase in rural inhabitants.

title: Limited Access to Electricity in Rural Areas
description: In 2023, only 0.4% of Chad's rural population had access to electricity, highlighting significant energy infrastructure challenges.

title: Low Electric Power Consumption
description: As of 2022, Chad's electric power consumption was 14.47 kWh per capita, indicating limited energy use and access.

title: High Lifetime Risk of Maternal Death
description: In 2023, the lifetime risk of maternal death in Chad was 1 in 24, underscoring critical healthcare challenges for women.

title: Low Literacy Rates Among Youth and Adults
description: In 2022, the literacy rate for youth aged 15-24 was 36.07%, while adult literacy was 27.28%, reflecting educational challenges.

title: Minimal Broadband Subscriptions
description: In 2019, Chad had only 68 fixed broadband subscriptions, equating to 0.0004 per 100 people, indicating limited internet access.

title: Threatened Fish Species
description: As of 2018, Chad had 1 threatened fish species, highlighting environmental concerns.

title: Low Human Capital Index for Females
description: In 2020, Chad's Human Capital Index for females was 0.29, indicating limited educational and health outcomes for women.

title: Limited Access to Basic Sanitation in Rural Areas
description: In 2022, only 4.51% of Chad's rural population had access to basic sanitation services, highlighting public health challenges.

title: Low Quality of Public Services for International Trade
description: In 2024, Chad scored 12.10 in the quality of public services for international trade, indicating barriers to trade facilitation.

title: High Average Working Hours for Children
description: In 2015, children aged 7-14 in Chad worked an average of 8.83 hours per week, reflecting child labor issues.

title: Low Control of Corruption
description: In 2022, Chad's control of corruption was ranked at the 47th percentile, indicating governance challenges.

title: Low Primary Completion Rate for Females
description: In 2021, only 37.69% of females in Chad completed primary education, highlighting gender disparities in education.

title: Low International Tourism Departures
description: In 2020, Chad recorded 5,500 international tourism departures, indicating limited tourism activity.

title: Low Literacy Rate Among Adult Females
description: In 2022, the literacy rate for adult females in Chad was 18.87%, highlighting gender disparities in education.

title: Low Educational Attainment for Females
description: In 2019, only 3.71% of females aged 25+ in Chad completed lower secondary education, indicating educational challenges.

title: Low Life Expectancy for Males
description: In 2023, the life expectancy at birth for males in Chad was 53.20 years, reflecting health and living condition challenges.
